FuncDef: The display mrt ipv6 routing-table command displays information about the MRT routing table of a VPN instance. The display mrt ipv6 routing-table command displays information about the MRT routing table of a VPN instance. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display mrt ipv6 routing-table [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] [ <ipv6prefix> [ <masklength> ] [ longer-match ] ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VPN instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters.

Specifies an IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the mask length of a destination address.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 128.

Displays only the routes that match the specified network or mask.
-

Displays detailed information about all routes in the current routing table, including active and inactive routes.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] display mrt ipv6 routing-table vpn vpn1 verbose
